alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clinton and northeastern Franklin Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Bryants Mill, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Malone, Burke, Churubusco, Debar Mountain, Merrill, Bryants Mill, Chateaugay, Lyon Mountain, Ellenburg, Earlville, Chazy Lake, West Bangor, Whippleville, Duane Center, Burke Center, Ellenburg Mountain, Harrigan, Ellenburg Center, and Owls Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton
